document_data.caption: Cover of Ruins of Adventure
document_data.title: Ruins of Adventure
document_data.author: [[Mike Breault]], [[David "Zeb" Cook]], [[James Ward|Jim Ward]], [[Steve Winter]]
document_data.Description:
''Ruins of Adventure'' contains four short ''Forgotten Realms'' adventure scenarios which are connected and adapted from the ''[[Pool of Radiance (game)|Pool of Radiance]]'' computer game, and take place in the devastated town of [[Phlan]]. There are numerous pre-generated characters in this book. Monsters each have their own stats prepared and there are quite a few non-player characters. 

''Ruins of Adventure'' was written by [[James Ward]], [[David "Zeb" Cook]], [[Steve Winter]], and [[Mike Breault]], with a cover by [[Clyde Caldwell]], and was published by TSR in 1988 as a 96-page book.
document_data.Summary: The adventurers are hired to remove evil forces from Phlan, presumably by killing them. They hear rumor of a ''Boss'' controlling them and seek him out. This ''Boss'' proves to be a worthy adversary, but in the end the adventurers defeat him.
document_data.Contents:
* Introduction
* Civilized Phlan
* Reconquest of Sokol Keep
* Kovel Mansion
* Mansions
* Slums
* The Temple of Bane
* Delving Into Kuto's Well
* Mantor's Library
* Stojanow Gate
* Podol Plaza
* The Cadorna Textile House
* Valhingen Graveyard
* Valjevo Castle
* Sorcerer's Island
* Zhentil Keep Outpost
* Thri-Kreen Village
* Orcs
* Nomad Camp
* Lizardmen Lair
* Kobolds Kingdom
* Hobgoblins
* Random Encounters Section
